INFO.name: QUERY
INFO.value: SELECT TOP 1 solution_id, source_id FROM gaiadr1.gaia_source

RESOURCE.INFO: SELECT TOP 1 solution_id, source_id FROM gaiadr1.gaia_source

PARAM.name: CITATION
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: How to cite and acknowledge Gaia:

PARAM.name: TERMS
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Terms and conditions for use of Gaia data:

FIELD.name: solution_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: All Gaia data processed by the Data Processing and Analysis Consortium comes tagged with a solution identifier. This is a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used. It is mainly for internal DPAC use but is included in the published data releases to enable end users to examine the provenance of processed data products. To decode a given solution ID visit

FIELD.name: source_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION:
A unique single numerical identifier of the source.
For the contents of Gaia DR1, which does not include Solar System objects, the source ID consists consists of a 64-bit integer, least significant bit = 1 and most significant bit = 64, comprising:
- a HEALPix index number (sky pixel) in bits 36 - 63; by definition the smallest HEALPix index number is zero.
- a 2-bit Data Processing Centre code in bits 34 - 35; for example MOD(sourceId / 4294967296, 8) can be used to distinguish between sources initialised via the Initial Gaia Source List by the Torino DPC (code = 0) and sources otherwise detected and assigned by Gaia observations (code >0)
- a 25-bit plus 7 bit sequence number within the HEALPix pixel in bits 1 - 32 split into:
- a 25 bit running number in bits 8 – 32; the running numbers are defined to be positive, i.e. never zero (except in the case of forced empty windows)
- a 7-bit component number in bits 1 – 7
- one spare bit in bit 33
This means that the HEALpix index level 12 of a given source is contained in the most significant bits. HEALpix index of 12 and lower levels can thus be retrieved as follows:
- HEALpix level 12 = source_id / 34359738368
- HEALpix level 11 = source_id / 137438953472
- HEALpix level 10 = source_id / 549755813888
- HEALpix level n = source_id / 2 ^ 35 * 4 ^ (12 - level).
Additional details can be found in the Gaia DPAC public document Source Identifiers — Assignment and Usage throughout DPAC (document code GAIA–C3–TN–ARI–BAS–020) available from
